title: Bug 7581: ComboBoxCellEditor does not size correctly in property sheet
description: From ECJoe Winchester <JoeWin@us.ibm.com wrote in message news:3C407F76.31A82113@us.ibm.com...
OB: When using ComboBoxCellEditor to edit objects in the PropertySheetViewer, if any of the strings in the dropdown list is wider than the width of the property sheet column, the combo box grows to be the width of the largest item, causing the dropdown button to be clipped and not visible within the property sheet.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the PropertySheetViewer.
2. Use IPropertyDescriptor to create a cell editor with the ComboBoxCellEditor constructor.
3. Set the strings for the dropdown list in the cell editor.
4. Set the cell editor in column two of the property sheet.
5. Make sure at least one of the strings is wider than the width of the column.
6. Observe that the dropdown button is clipped and not visible within the property sheet.
